com.bugsnag.android

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.bugsnag.android.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Client
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.Observer
    A Bugsnag Client instance allows you to use Bugsnag in your Android app. Typically you'd instead use the static access provided in the Bugsnag class.

    Example usage:

    Client client = new Client(this, "your-api-key"); client.notify(new RuntimeException("something broke!"));

    See Also:
    Bugsnag

        Specified by:

      • startSession

        public void startSession()
        Manually starts tracking a new session. Automatic session tracking can be enabled via Configuration.setAutoCaptureSessions(boolean), which will automatically create a new session everytime the app enters the foreground.

      • startFirstSession

        public void startFirstSession(android.app.Activity activity)
        Starts tracking a new session only if no sessions have yet been tracked This is an integration point for custom libraries implementing automatic session capture which differs from the default activity-based initialization.

      • setAppVersion

        public void setAppVersion(java.lang.String appVersion)
        Set the application version sent to Bugsnag. By default we'll pull this from your AndroidManifest.xml
        Parameters:
        appVersion - the app version to send

      • getContext

        public java.lang.String getContext()
        Gets the context to be sent to Bugsnag.
        Returns:
        Context

      • setContext

        public void setContext(java.lang.String context)
        Set the context sent to Bugsnag. By default we'll attempt to detect the name of the top-most activity at the time of a report, and use this as the context, but sometime this is not possible.
        Parameters:
        context - set what was happening at the time of a crash

      • setEndpoint

        @Deprecated
public void setEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Deprecated. use Configuration.setEndpoints(String, String) instead.
        Set the endpoint to send data to. By default we'll send reports to the standard https://notify.bugsnag.com endpoint, but you can override this if you are using Bugsnag Enterprise to point to your own Bugsnag endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - the custom endpoint to send report to

      • setBuildUUID

        public void setBuildUUID(java.lang.String buildUuid)
        Set the buildUUID to your own value. This is used to identify proguard mapping files in the case that you publish multiple different apps with the same appId and versionCode. The default value is read from the com.bugsnag.android.BUILD_UUID meta-data field in your app manifest.
        Parameters:
        buildUuid - the buildUuid.

      • setFilters

        public void setFilters(java.lang.String... filters)
        Set which keys should be filtered when sending metaData to Bugsnag. Use this when you want to ensure sensitive information, such as passwords or credit card information is stripped from metaData you send to Bugsnag. Any keys in metaData which contain these strings will be marked as [FILTERED] when send to Bugsnag.

        For example:

        client.setFilters("password", "credit_card");

        Parameters:
        filters - a list of keys to filter from metaData

      • setIgnoreClasses

        public void setIgnoreClasses(java.lang.String... ignoreClasses)
        Set which exception classes should be ignored (not sent) by Bugsnag.

        For example:

        client.setIgnoreClasses("java.lang.RuntimeException");

        Parameters:
        ignoreClasses - a list of exception classes to ignore

      • setNotifyReleaseStages

        public void setNotifyReleaseStages(java.lang.String... notifyReleaseStages)
        Set for which releaseStages errors should be sent to Bugsnag. Use this to stop errors from development builds being sent.

        For example:

        client.setNotifyReleaseStages("production");

        Parameters:
        notifyReleaseStages - a list of releaseStages to notify for
        See Also:
        setReleaseStage(java.lang.String)

      • setProjectPackages

        public void setProjectPackages(java.lang.String... projectPackages)
        Set which packages should be considered part of your application. Bugsnag uses this to help with error grouping, and stacktrace display.

        For example:

        client.setProjectPackages("com.example.myapp");

        By default, we'll mark the current package name as part of you app.

        Parameters:
        projectPackages - a list of package names

      • setReleaseStage

        public void setReleaseStage(java.lang.String releaseStage)
        Set the current "release stage" of your application. By default, we'll set this to "development" for debug builds and "production" for non-debug builds.
        Parameters:
        releaseStage - the release stage of the app
        See Also:
        setNotifyReleaseStages(java.lang.String...)

      • setSendThreads

        public void setSendThreads(boolean sendThreads)
        Set whether to send thread-state with report. By default, this will be true.
        Parameters:
        sendThreads - should we send thread-state with report?

      • setAutoCaptureSessions

        public void setAutoCaptureSessions(boolean autoCapture)
        Sets whether or not Bugsnag should automatically capture and report User sessions whenever the app enters the foreground.

        By default this behavior is disabled.

        Parameters:
        autoCapture - whether sessions should be captured automatically

      • setUser

        public void setUser(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String email,
                    java.lang.String name)
        Set details of the user currently using your application. You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.

        For example:

        client.setUser("12345", "james@example.com", "James Smith");

        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier of the current user (defaults to a unique id)
        email - the email address of the current user
        name - the name of the current user

      • getUser

        public com.bugsnag.android.User getUser()
        Retrieves details of the user currently using your application. You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.
        Returns:
        the current user

        public void setUserId(java.lang.String id)
        Set a unique identifier for the user currently using your application. By default, this will be an automatically generated unique id You can search for this information in your Bugsnag dashboard.
        Parameters:
        id - a unique identifier of the current user

        Parameters:

      • beforeNotify

        public void beforeNotify(BeforeNotify beforeNotify)
        Add a "before notify" callback, to execute code before every report to Bugsnag.

        You can use this to add or modify information attached to an error before it is sent to your dashboard. You can also return false from any callback to halt execution.

        For example:

        client.beforeNotify(new BeforeNotify() { public boolean run(Error error) { error.setSeverity(Severity.INFO); return true; } })

        Parameters:
        beforeNotify - a callback to run before sending errors to Bugsnag
        See Also:
        BeforeNotify

      • beforeRecordBreadcrumb

        public void beforeRecordBreadcrumb(BeforeRecordBreadcrumb beforeRecordBreadcrumb)
        Add a "before breadcrumb" callback, to execute code before every breadcrumb captured by Bugsnag.

        You can use this to modify breadcrumbs before they are stored by Bugsnag. You can also return false from any callback to ignore a breadcrumb.

        For example:

        Bugsnag.beforeRecordBreadcrumb(new BeforeRecordBreadcrumb() { public boolean shouldRecord(Breadcrumb breadcrumb) { return false; // ignore the breadcrumb } })

        Parameters:
        beforeRecordBreadcrumb - a callback to run before a breadcrumb is captured
        See Also:
        BeforeRecordBreadcrumb

      • notify

        public void notify(java.lang.Throwable exception)
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag

                   Callback callback)
        Notify Bugsnag of a handled exception
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to send to Bugsnag
        callback - callback invoked on the generated error report for additional modification

      • internalClientNotify

        public void internalClientNotify(java.lang.Throwable exception,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> clientData,
                                 boolean blocking,
                                 Callback callback)
        Intended for internal use only
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception
        clientData - the clientdata
        blocking - whether to block when notifying
        callback - a callback when notifying

      • addToTab

        public void addToTab(java.lang.String tab,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Add diagnostic information to every error report. Diagnostic information is collected in "tabs" on your dashboard.

        For example:

        client.addToTab("account", "name", "Acme Co."); client.addToTab("account", "payingCustomer", true);

        Parameters:
        tab - the dashboard tab to add diagnostic data to
        key - the name of the diagnostic information
        value - the contents of the diagnostic information

      • clearTab

        public void clearTab(java.lang.String tabName)
        Remove a tab of app-wide diagnostic information
        Parameters:
        tabName - the dashboard tab to remove diagnostic data from

      • getMetaData

        public MetaData getMetaData()
        Get the global diagnostic information currently stored in MetaData.
        See Also:
        MetaData

      • setMetaData

        public void setMetaData(MetaData metaData)
        Set the global diagnostic information to be send with every error.
        See Also:
        MetaData

      • leaveBreadcrumb

        public void leaveBreadcrumb(java.lang.String breadcrumb)
        Leave a "breadcrumb" log message, representing an action that occurred in your app, to aid with debugging.
        Parameters:
        breadcrumb - the log message to leave (max 140 chars)

      • leaveBreadcrumb

        public void leaveBreadcrumb(java.lang.String name,
                            BreadcrumbType type,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)

      • setMaxBreadcrumbs

        @Deprecated
public void setMaxBreadcrumbs(int numBreadcrumbs)
        Deprecated. use Configuration.setMaxBreadcrumbs(int) instead
        Set the maximum number of breadcrumbs to keep and sent to Bugsnag. By default, we'll keep and send the 20 most recent breadcrumb log messages.
        Parameters:
        numBreadcrumbs - number of breadcrumb log messages to send

      • clearBreadcrumbs

        public void clearBreadcrumbs()
        Clear any breadcrumbs that have been left so far.

      • enableExceptionHandler

        public void enableExceptionHandler()
        Enable automatic reporting of unhandled exceptions. By default, this is automatically enabled in the constructor.

      • disableExceptionHandler

        public void disableExceptionHandler()
        Disable automatic reporting of unhandled exceptions.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Finalize by removing the receiver
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if something goes wrong

      • setLoggingEnabled

        public void setLoggingEnabled(boolean loggingEnabled)
        Sets whether the SDK should write logs. In production apps, it is recommended that this should be set to false.

        Logging is enabled by default unless the release stage is set to 'production', in which case it will be disabled.

        Parameters:
        loggingEnabled - true if logging is enabled

      • getConfig

        public Configuration getConfig()
        Returns the configuration used to initialise the client
        Returns:
        the config

      • getLaunchTimeMs

        public long getLaunchTimeMs()
        Retrieves the time at which the client was launched
        Returns:
        the ms since the java epoch
